importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date marks the conclusion of the ALCS Game 7 and the Blue Jays' advancement to the World Series, a pivotal moment in MLB postseason history.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The seventh inning stretch represents the turning point in the game, where George Springer’s home run shifted the momentum and secured the Blue Jays' victory.

keyTakeAways: George Springer hits a three-run home run in the seventh inning to give the Toronto Blue Jays a winning lead in Game 7 of the ALCS.
The Blue Jays defeat the Seattle Mariners 4-3 in a dramatic Game 7 victory, advancing to their first World Series since 1993.
The game features controversy over a groundball play involving Ernie Clement and Josh Naylor, with umpires ruling that Naylor deliberately obstructed the throw.
Julio Rodriguez hits three home runs during the series, including a solo shot in the third inning and a two-run blast in the fifth.
Cal Raleigh, the MLB regular season home run leader, hits five long balls in the playoffs, including four against the Blue Jays.
Vladimir Guerrero Jr. is named ALCS MVP with a .385 batting average and three home runs in the series.
Chris Bassitt and Jeff Hoffman close out the game with a scoreless eighth and ninth inning, respectively.
The Blue Jays will host the Los Angeles Dodgers in Game 1 of the World Series on October 25, 2025.
The Seattle Mariners remain the only MLB franchise never to have appeared in a World Series, making their ALCS loss particularly significant.

namedEntities.name: George Springer
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He delivered a three-run home run in the seventh inning, turning the game around and securing the Blue Jays' victory in Game 7.

namedEntities.name: Toronto Blue Jays
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: They won the ALCS Game 7 to advance to the World Series for the first time since 1993.

namedEntities.name: Seattle Mariners
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: They lost Game 7 of the ALCS, marking their first postseason exit since 2022 and remaining the only MLB franchise never to have reached the World Series.

namedEntities.name: Julio Rodriguez
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He hit three home runs during the ALCS, including a solo shot in the third and a two-run blast in the fifth inning.

namedEntities.name: Cal Raleigh
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He led MLB in regular-season home runs and hit five long balls in the playoffs, including four against the Blue Jays.

namedEntities.name: Vladimir Guerrero Jr.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He was named ALCS MVP with a .385 batting average and three home runs in the series.

namedEntities.name: Eduardo Bazardo
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He was the pitcher facing George Springer in the game-winning at-bat in the seventh inning.

namedEntities.name: Shane Bieber
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He was the pitcher who gave up a solo home run to Julio Rodriguez in the third inning of Game 7.

namedEntities.name: Ernie Clement
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He was involved in a controversial play where a groundball ricocheted off Josh Naylor’s helmet, leading to a disputed call that was eventually overturned.

namedEntities.name: Josh Naylor
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He drove in Julio Rodriguez with a single in the first inning and was involved in a controversial play where his back-turned movement led to a disputed obstruction call.

namedEntities.name: Jorge Polanco
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He hit a groundball in the first inning that led to a disputed call involving Ernie Clement and Josh Naylor.

namedEntities.name: Chris Bassitt
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He pitched a scoreless eighth inning in Game 7, helping to preserve the Blue Jays’ lead.

namedEntities.name: Jeff Hoffman
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He pitched a perfect ninth inning to close out the game and secure the Blue Jays’ victory.

namedEntities.name: Los Angeles Dodgers
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: They are the defending champions and will face the Blue Jays in the World Series, making the matchup a major storyline.

namedEntities.name: Rogers Centre
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: It is the venue where the Blue Jays played their decisive Game 7 victory and where the crowd celebrated the win.

summaryOfNewsArticle: The Toronto Blue Jays defeated the Seattle Mariners 4-3 in a dramatic Game 7 of the American League Championship Series, advancing to their first World Series since 1993. The pivotal moment came when George Springer hit a three-run home run in the seventh inning, turning the game around after being out of the game due to injury in earlier contests. The game featured a controversial play involving Josh Naylor and Ernie Clement, where a ricocheting ball led to a disputed obstruction call. The Blue Jays’ victory is significant because it marks their return to the World Series and ends a 32-year drought, while the Seattle Mariners remain the only MLB franchise never to reach a World Series. Vladimir Guerrero Jr. earned ALCS MVP honors with a .385 average and three home runs. The Blue Jays will host the defending champions, the Los Angeles Dodgers, in Game 1 of the World Series on October 25, 2025.
title: George Springer’s epic home run helps send the Toronto Blue Jays to the World Series with ALCS Game 7 win over Seattle
